content.statement: vascular:trauma:trauma-016-endovascular-trauma is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Trauma that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding vascular:trauma:trauma-016-endovascular-trauma helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of vascular:trauma:trauma-016-endovascular-trauma include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of vascular:trauma:trauma-016-endovascular-trauma.

TEVAR_for_BTAI.indication: Grade II-IV blunt thoracic aortic injury
TEVAR_for_BTAI.outcomes: Lower mortality and paraplegia than open repair
TEVAR_for_BTAI.landing_zones: Usually Zone 3 (post-left subclavian); Zone 2 coverage acceptable with left carotid-subclavian bypass if needed
TEVAR_for_BTAI.left_subclavian: Can be covered if needed; revascularize if symptomatic, dominant vertebral, or LIMA-LAD graft
TEVAR_for_BTAI.timing: Within 24 hours; can delay for other injuries if contained

covered_stents.subclavian: Excellent for Zone 1-2 injuries; consider bypass if covers vertebral origin
covered_stents.iliac: Good option for stable patients with iliac injury
covered_stents.axillary: May use if anatomy permits and patient stable
covered_stents.limitations: Long-term durability unknown in young patients, infection risk in contaminated wounds

REBOA.mechanism: Balloon occlusion of aorta to control hemorrhage and augment central perfusion

zones.Zone_I: Supraceliac (between left subclavian and celiac) - for abdominal hemorrhage
zones.Zone_III: Infrarenal to bifurcation - for pelvic hemorrhage

REBOA.technique: Femoral access, balloon catheter positioned under fluoroscopy or landmark guidance
REBOA.duration: Limit to <60-90 minutes to minimize ischemic complications
REBOA.role: Bridge to OR, not definitive treatment

definition.@value: The application of endovascular techniques including TEVAR, covered stents, embolization, and REBOA to manage vascular injuries, offering less invasive alternatives to open surgery in selected patients.

citations.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.

learning_objectives: Describe the role of TEVAR in blunt thoracic aortic injury
Identify applications for covered stents in vascular trauma
Recognize limitations of endovascular approaches in trauma
clinical_pearls: TEVAR is now FIRST-LINE for blunt thoracic aortic injury - better outcomes than open
Left subclavian coverage usually tolerated - revascularize if symptomatic
REBOA Zone I = supraceliac = abdominal hemorrhage
REBOA Zone III = infrarenal = pelvic hemorrhage
REBOA is a BRIDGE, not definitive treatment - limit time <60-90 minutes
Covered stent infection risk in contaminated wounds - consider staged approach

medicalCode.description: Endovascular repair of descending thoracic aorta
